description: the CDR approach being described (e.g. direct air capture, enhanced rock weathering, etc.)
a paragraph descibing the pathway at a high level (currently used at the top of the tool to set the stage for the diagrams / components)

verification confidence level; a rolled-up representation of combined uncertainty across the pathway's MRV components; defined on a scale of 1-5 and represented at the pathway level as a range (e.g. 3,5 --> 3 to 5)
an equation representing how diagram components combine to quantify net CO2 sequestration
component name that is shared between the diagram and the associated structured data
the outcome (operations, gross volume, net volume permanence) that a particular MRV component informs
short name describing the component (currently used in the volume equation, but might become obselete)
short description of the component (currently used in the tool legend)
longer description of the component and how it is measured or modeled
the kind of uncertainty is associated with an MRV component given the best case MRV approach (execution, scientific, counterfactual)
the magnitude of uncertainty associated with an MRV component given the best case MRV approach (negligible, low, medium, high, very high)
who has primary responsibility for reducing the uncertainty associated with a particular element
